meanings.definition: Having more billows or waves than something else.
meanings.sent1: The billowier clouds in the sky signaled an approaching storm.
meanings.sent2: The ocean looked billowier than usual during the windy day.
meanings.sent3: The billowier curtains in the room made it feel like a ghost was hiding behind them.
meanings.sent4: Her billowier hair flowed in the wind like a golden waterfall.
meanings.sent5: The billowier sails of the ship caught the strong wind and propelled it forward swiftly.
